title: Liver Surgery Training Scenario-Based Education Curriculum

context.prior_knowledge: Elementary-level understanding of basic human anatomy and surgical procedures
context.additional_context: Conducted in a smartphone-centric limited technological environment, this program strengthens decision-making and procedural training through scenarios based on actual surgical cases

learning_goals: Learners can determine resectable areas with 80% accuracy by analyzing pre-operative liver surgery imaging data.
Learners can explain the process of establishing surgical plans through virtual resection simulations using 3D models.
Learners can identify at least three core elements of the surgical decision-making process by analyzing real surgical cases (videos, reports, etc.).

resources: Radiological Imaging Materials and Surgical Case Archive
constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
